titlestmt.titleproper: Social Science Research Council records, Administration and Officers Files, Office Files of Lonnie Sherrod
A Guide to the Social Science Research Council records, Administration and Officers Files, Office Files of Lonnie Sherrod FA1792

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2024-03-13 18:19:10 -0400.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.unittitle: Social Science Research Council records, Administration and Officers Files, Office Files of Lonnie Sherrod

physdesc.extent: 64 boxes (48 letter document storage boxes, 13 legal document storage boxes, 2 35mm microfilm boxes, and 1 half letter document storage box)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of administrative files, research materials, grant applications, publications, and reports created and received by Lonnie Sherrod in his role as a Social Science Research Council (SSRC) staff liaison to several SSRC committees. Sherrod was the staff liaison to the following SSRC committees: the Committee on Life-Course Perspective, the Subcommittee on Child Development in Life-Span Perspective, the Committee on Development, Giftedness, and the Learning Process, and the Committee on Biosocial Perspectives on Parental Biology and Offspring Development.

The collection also contains files related to the creation of SSRC publications, including An Inventory of Longitudinal Research on Childhood and Adolescence authored by Frederick Verdonik and Lonnie Sherrod, Human Development and the Life Course: Multidisciplinary Perspectives edited by Aage B. SÃ¸rensen, Franz E. Weinert, Lonnie R. Sherrod, and An Inventory of Longitudinal Studies of Middle and Old Age compiled by Susan Migdal, Robald B. Abeles, and Lonnie Sherrod. Some material in the collection relates to Sherrod's role as Treasurer for the Society for the Study of Social Biology (SSSB). The files in Series 1 were created by David Jenness, SSRC Staff Associate assigned to the Committee on Biological Bases of Social Behavior, prior to Sherrod's time at the SSRC.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research with select materials restricted as noted. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC. Researchers interested in accessing digital media (floppy disks, CDs, DVDs, etc.) in this collection must use an access surrogate. The original items may not be accessed because of preservation concerns. To request an access surrogate be made, or if you are unsure if there is an access surrogate, please contact an archivist.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Collection is arranged in eight series:
1. Committee on Biological Bases of Social Behavior, 1960-1976
2. Subcommittee on Child Development in Life-Span Perspective, 1982-1987
3. Committee on Life-Course Perspectives on Human Development, 1977-1987
4. Committee on Development, Giftedness, and the Learning Process, 1981-1986
5. Inventory of Longitudinal Research on Childhood and Adolescence, 1975-1986
6. Committee on Biosocial Perspectives on Parent Behavior, 1981-1986

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The records in this collection were received by the Rockefeller Archive Center from the Social Science Research Council in 2016 and 2017.

did.unittitle: Committee on Biological Bases of Social Behavior

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Social Science Research Council's Committee on Biological Bases of Social Behavior (1966-1979), previously the Committee on Genetics and Behavior (1961-1966), studied the relationship between biology and social science. The committee focused their efforts on understanding how environmental and biological factors impact social class, intelligence, and behavior pathology. One of the committee's most significant projects was a comprehensive survey of the relevant research and policy questions concerning the scholastic achievements and intelligence of children of different races.

The committee sponsored summer training institutes over a 10-year period to provide training in biology, behavior genetics, population genetics, neurobiology, and psychophysiology to early career social scientists. Through conferences and workshops on topics in the same areas (population biology, neurobiology, and psychophysiology), the committee encouraged research examining the contributions of genetics to the study of social behavior.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The files in this series were created by David Jenness, SSRC Staff Associate assigned to the Committee on Biological Bases of Social Behavior. They were inventoried as part of Lonnie Sherrod's office files.

Subcommittee on Child Development in Life-Span Perspective

physdesc.extent: 9 legal document boxes and 6 letter document boxes

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Social Science Research Council's Subcommittee on Child Development in Life-Span Perspective (1981-1986) was created as a subcommittee of the SSRC's Committee on Life-Course Perspectives on Human Development (see Series 3). The subcommittee was supported by funding from the Foundation for Child Development. The subcommittee sponsored conferences, workshops, and a summer institute for early career social scientists at the Center for the Advanced Study of Behavioral Sciences. In 1984, the subcommittee published an Inventory of Longitudinal Research on Childhood and Adolescence compiled by Frederick Verdonik and Lonnie Sherrod. The working files of the inventory are housed in Series 5.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains meeting, conference, and workshop files, planning materials related to subcommittee publications, and correspondence related to the life-course longitudinal research archive later housed at the Henry A. Murray Research Center of Radcliffe College.

did.unittitle: Committee on Life-Course Perspectives on Human Development

physdesc.extent: 19 letter document boxes and 6 legal document boxes

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Social Science Research Council's Committee on Life-Course Perspectives on Human Development (originally called the Committee on Life-Course Perspective on Middle and Old Age) was active from 1977-1987. The committee's original mandate was to gain a deeper understanding of middle and old age by employing a life-course perspective and working directly with selected ongoing longitudinal and historical studies. By 1982, the committee focused on life-course research beyond middle and old age. The Committee sponsored workshops, conferences, and publications to facilitate life-course research. The committee received funding from the Charles A. Dana Foundation and the Volkswagen Foundation. In 1981, the Subcommittee on Child Development in Life-Span Perspective was created as a subcommittee of the SSRC's Committee on Life-Course Perspectives on Human Development (see Series 2).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The series contains correspondence, papers, grant reports to the Charles A. Dana Foundation, research planning materials, conference and meeting files, chapters from Human Development and the Life Course: Multidisciplinary Perspectives edited by Aage B. SÃ¸rensen, Franz E. Weinert,and Lonnie R. Sherrod published by Psychology Press in 1986, grant reports to the Volkswagen Foundation, and requests related to An Inventory of Longitudinal Studies of Middle and Old Age by Susan Migdal, Ronald P. Abele, and Lonnie Sherrod published by the Social Science Research Council in 1981.

Committee on Development, Giftedness, and the Learning Process

physdesc.extent: 5 letter document boxes and 3 legal document boxes

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Social Science Research Council's Committee on Development, Giftedness, and the Learning Process (1980-1990) was created following the conclusion of the Committee on Gifted Children (1975-1980). The Committee was tasked with exploring the concept of giftedness, the identification of the gifted individual, and educational provisions for gifted individuals. The Committee studied the nature and conditions of exceptional performance within domains such as art, music, and science. That committee's initial activities were supported by the American Psychological Foundation with funds from the estate of Esther Katz Rosen and later received funding from the Mellon Foundation.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The series contains materials related to committee funding from the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation, correspondence, and meeting and workshop files.

did.unittitle: Inventory of Longitudinal Research on Childhood and Adolescence

physdesc.extent: 10 letter document boxes and 3 legal document boxes

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: In 1984, the Social Science Research Council's Subcommittee on Child Development in Life-Span Perspective, a subcommittee of the Committee on Life-Course Perspectives on Human Development published an Inventory of Longitudinal Research on Childhood and Adolescence compiled by Frederick Verdonik and Lonnie Sherrod. The inventory summarizes 116 studies. The summaries include the title of the study, names and affiliations of the investigators, disciplines covered, years of completed waves, instruments used for data collection, future plans for the study, references, and indicated whether the study is active and available for further study. This inventory followed a previous inventory called An Inventory of Longitudinal Studies of Middle and Old Age compiled by Susan Migdal, Robald B. Abeles, and Lonnie Sherrod that was published by the Committee on Life-Course Perspectives on Human Development in 1981.

In 1986, the Committee coordinated with the Henry A. Murray Research Center of Radcliffe College to continue developing the inventory and archiving more recent studies. In 1991, the Council published a revised volume titled Inventory of Longitudinal Studies in the Social Sciences, edited by Copeland H. Young, Kristen L. Savola, and Erin Phelps. Funding for the project was provided by a grant from the National Institute of Mental Health to Radcliffe College.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The series consists of working documents related to the Inventory of Longitudinal Research on Childhood and Adolescence, an SSRC publication compiled by Frederick Verdonik and Lonnie Sherrod. The series contains forms filled out by study investigators, inventory summaries, correspondence, and drafts.

Committee on Biosocial Perspectives on Parent Behavior

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Social Science Research Council's Committee on Biosocial Perspectives on Parent Behavior was active from 1980-1991. The Committee built upon the SSRC's previous work in the fields of human behavior and biology in the Committee on Biological Bases of Social Behavior (1966-1979) and the Committee on Biosocial Science (1976-1980). The committee consisted of biological, behavioral, and social scientists with the goals of exploring the interplay between biological and social phenomena and advancing understanding of human behavior. The Committee received funding from the William T. Grant Foundation.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The series contains correspondence, grant reports, conference files, and meeting materials.

physdesc.extent: 10 letter document boxes, 2 legal document boxes, 1 half-letter box

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series consists of administrative files related to Lonnie Sherrod's obligations to the Social Science Research Council and the committees on which he served as a staff liaison. The series contains correspondence, notes, drafts of annual reports, and material related to his role as Treasurer for the Society for the Study of Social Biology (SSSB) from 1984-1990.

The original items may not be accessed because of preservation concerns. To request an access surrogate be made, or if you are unsure if there is an access surrogate, please contact an archivist.

did.unittitle: Publications

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series consists of books, journals, and newsletters that Lonnie Sherrod received in the course of his work with the Social Science Research Council.
